Detailed Description

Defines an area of the screen to be used to display text.

Created from a font resource.

Note that this is a container class; it does not draw. It will create sprites -- as children -- for the letters of text. The sprites will be fully managed by the text box and should not be changed by the client.

If hit testing, it may be necessary to check the Parent's parent to see if it is a text box.

int    width,
int    height,
int    lineSpacing,
Alignment    alignment = LEFT
) 
 

Create a box that contains text.

Parameters:
resource  A pointer to the font to use.
width  Width of the text box.
height  Height of the text box.
lineSpacing  Pixels of padding between each line.
alignment  LEFT, RIGHT, or CENTER justification.

Member Function Documentation

virtual KrImNode* KrTextBox::Clone (    )  [virtual]
 

Return a copy if this object, not in a Tree().

It is return untransformed. In the case of a sprite, the action and frame will be set to the current value.
